meanings.definition: To pour (a liquid) from one container into another, typically without disturbing the sediment.
meanings.sent1: She carefully decants the juice into a glass.
meanings.sent2: He always decants the milk before serving it.
meanings.sent3: The magician decants the potion into a crystal vial for his next trick.
meanings.sent4: The sun decants its golden rays over the horizon at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The chef decants the sauce with precision, creating a masterpiece dish.

meanings.definition: To transfer (wine or other liquid) from one container to another, typically in order to separate out sediment.
meanings.sent1: Mom decants the wine into a decanter to let it breathe.
meanings.sent2: The bartender decants the aged whiskey into a glass for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally knocks over the vase, causing it to decant water all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The river decants its muddy waters into the calm lake, creating a swirling pattern.
meanings.sent5: The scientist decants the solution carefully, observing the sediment settle at the bottom.
